page.title: 06HOUSING IN CHITTERNE
page.content: There are several large houses, notably Manor House, which is a Grade II, Elizabethan building, and The Old Vicarage, now a private dwelling. Throughout the remainder of the area there are only a few scattered farmhouses and associated farmworkers' cottages. House prices are steadily increasing and there are only a few properties on the market, including one or two building plots. In the West Wiltshire Rural District Policy Statement, Chitterne qualifies for limited residential development. The local view is that small scale housing should be encouraged and the Structure Plan for the area allows for infill housing only.
